nodes.title: 1. Name
nodes.body: The monastery’s full name is Kun ’brog (pronounced as Kub ro) g-yung drung dgon.

nodes.title: 2. Location
nodes.body: The monastery is located 35 km southeast of ’Bar khams Township, the seat of county.

nodes.title: 3. History
nodes.body: According to oral tradition, the monastery was founded two thousand years ago, but there are no written records and the details of its history remain unknown.

nodes.title: 4. Hierarchical system
nodes.body:
• one bla ma
  • two dge skos
  • two gnyer pa

The dge bskos and gnyer pa are replaced every two years.

nodes.title: 5. Current number of monks
nodes.body: There were twenty-one novices and monks in the monastery in autumn 1998.

nodes.title: 6. Current education
nodes.body: The novice monks are trained by the elder monks.

nodes.title: 7. Educational exchanges
nodes.body: The monastery is regarded as a branch of sNang zhig Monastery (No.180) in rNga khog and sends its novices there to study. There were five monks from sNang zhig Monastery when I visited the monastery in autumn 1998.

nodes.title: 8 / 9. Rituals
nodes.body: The observance of the smyung gnas fasting from the 10th to the 15th day of the 4th month; the ritual based on the mNyam med bla sgrub from the 1st to the 6th of the 5th month; the ritual cycle of Khro bo from the the 15th to the 20th day of the 12th month.

nodes.title: 10. Books held in the monastery
nodes.body: The monastery does not possess any collection of books. Only a few of the monks possess their own texts for liturgical purposes.

nodes.title: 11. Income and expenses
nodes.body: The monastery depends on donations and has no regular Sources of income. The monks provide their own food.

nodes.title: 12. Local community
nodes.body: The local lay community consists of two villlages: Kur bu with twenty families and Kor tag with thirty-six families.

nodes.title: (2) Texts
nodes.body: 1. rNga khul ’bar khams rdzong gi kun ’brog g-yung drung dgon pa’i lo rgyus mdor bsdus, in rNga ba khul gyi dgon pa’i lo rgyus, the Religion Bureau and Buddhist Association of rNga ba Prefecture, p.202
